title: Military Inventions (Tell Me Why #105)(gnv64)
description:
Military Inventions (Tell Me Why #105)
By Manorama
Manorama | June 2015 | PDF | 97 pages | 13.6 mb
scanned to PDF by me.

GIFTS FROM THE BATTLEFIELD
Wars bring terror, and gory pictures of blood, death, and tears. Yet they often bring boons too, in the form of innovations that improve the quality of our lives. Beyond victory and defeat, wars across history have brought mankind many useful things. It is as if military action holds destruction in one hand, and creation in the other, in its death dance for glory.
From jungle boots to canned food, the Internet to the microwave oven, many military inventions have entered our daily lives, changing the way we live. All of these were by-products of military technology, invented primarily to make war more efficient. But they survived the battle-fields, and stayed with us to make life easier.
This issue of TELL ME WHY tells the captivating story of unique military inventions that changed our life styles forever.
